run.name: Batch 1 - Feb 2026 Prospects
run.ab_variable: Pain hook: Group A = Maintenance angle, Group B = Velocity angle

prospects.name: Olga Manuylova
prospects.title: Director QA Eng
prospects.key_detail: 19+ years testing, led 75+ QAs, 60+ projects, AI-powered testing, ex-Deutsche Bank, ex-Luxoft
prospects.touch_1_body:
Been following your work heading up QA at AlfaBit Group - the scale of your team there caught my attention.

Every time compliance rules or fraud detection logic changes at AlfaBit Group, the regression surface probably expands.

CRED faced the same challenge. By automating smarter, they went from 90% regression automation to 5x faster execution. Game-changer for their velocity.

Let me know if this feels like something worth 15 minutes to discuss.
prospects.touch_3: One more angle I didn't mention - thought of a different proof point: CRED got 90% regression automation down to 5x faster execution. Might be more relevant to your situation. Would be happy to dig deeper if it's relevant to what you're working on.
prospects.touch_6: Hey Olga, leaving you with this - no more follow-ups from me. If the pain of regression testing becomes the priority, happy to pick this back up. Either way, appreciate you taking the time to read this.
prospects.call_snippet_1:
Hey Olga, this is Rob from Testsigma - I noticed you're heading up QA strategy at AlfaBit Group.
Payment and trading platforms need airtight regression coverage, but the cost of maintaining it at AlfaBit Group's velocity is probably steep.
We helped CRED solve similar problems - worth 60 seconds to see if it's relevant?
prospects.call_snippet_2:
Hey Olga, this is Rob from Testsigma - I noticed you're heading up QA strategy at AlfaBit Group.
API-heavy platforms like AlfaBit Group's mean test brittleness when integrations evolve.
We helped Hansard solve similar problems - worth 60 seconds to see if it's relevant?

objection.response: We've worked with Nasdaq, CRED, Hansard, and other highly regulated platforms. Happy to walk through our compliance, audit, and governance story.

prospects.name: Indu Thomas
prospects.title: Sr Director Quality Eng
prospects.key_detail: Extensive QE & ops experience, joined March 2024
prospects.company_detail: Life sciences data cloud SaaS platform
prospects.touch_1_body:
Your role building QA infrastructure at TetraScience across 800 employees is impressive.

Regulated platforms like TetraScience's need bulletproof coverage, but manual maintenance is eating into your velocity.

We helped Medibuddy solve this exact problem. 2,500 tests automated meant they could cut 50% maintenance cut off their regression cycles. Freed up the whole team.

Curious what you think. If it resonates, let's grab a time to talk through it. That's especially true for life sciences data cloud saas platform where every test that breaks costs time.
prospects.touch_3: Wanted to loop back with something - came across another angle: Medibuddy's 2,500 tests automated dropped to 50% maintenance cut. Wondering if that resonates more. No pressure, but if this is something you're wrestling with, let's talk. For life sciences platforms especially, that kind of reduction in maintenance drag frees up your team to focus on coverage expansion.
prospects.touch_6: Hey Indu, wrapping up my outreach. If scaling QA becomes urgent, reach out. Otherwise, best of luck with your current focus. Wishing you and your team the best with extensive qe & ops experience, joined march 2024.
prospects.call_snippet_1:
Hey Indu, this is Rob from Testsigma - I noticed you're heading up QA strategy at TetraScience.
Regulated platforms like TetraScience's need bulletproof coverage, but manual maintenance is eating into your velocity.
We helped Medibuddy solve similar problems - worth 60 seconds to see if it's relevant?
prospects.call_snippet_2:
Hey Indu, this is Rob from Testsigma - I noticed you're heading up QA strategy at TetraScience.
Care coordination platforms generate complex test cases that fragment across your team.
We helped Sanofi solve similar problems - worth 60 seconds to see if it's relevant?

objection.response: We work with Sanofi, Medidata, Hinge Health, and other healthcare platforms. Happy to walk through our compliance and audit trail story.

prospects.name: Rafi Zeituni
prospects.title: Director of QA
prospects.key_detail: Ex-CME Group Head QA, Ex-Traiana Director QA, post-trade processing expert
prospects.touch_1_body:
Your role building QA infrastructure at EX.CO across 400 employees is impressive.

Multi-tenant platforms like EX.CO's have to regression test across customer configs - that's a matrix problem.

Spendflo was drowning in test maintenance until they automated their regression cycles. 50% manual testing became cut in first quarter. Huge shift.

Curious what you think. If it resonates, let's grab a time to talk through it. Curious how this lands with ex-cme group head qa, ex-traiana director qa, post-trade processing expert right now.

Hey Rafi, this is Rob from Testsigma - you're doing interesting work on the Director of QA side at EX.CO.

Hey Rafi, this is Rob from Testsigma - you're doing interesting work on the Director of QA side at EX.CO.

objection.response: Totally fair. Most teams we've worked with had something in place too. The gap they kept hitting was maintenance drag when UIs change - they'd spend days reworking. Worth comparing to see if we solve that differently?
